RESOURCE.Description: Master STRING table for all ECM Diagnostic Tests and Special Features
RESOURCE.STRING: Welcome to the ECM Diagnostic Tests Wizard.
This wizard helps you through the steps needed to run an ECM Diagnostic Test.
To continue, select a test from the list below and press the Next button.
You are attempting to close a window containing an active ECM Test. Do you want to terminate the active test?
No ECM Diagnostic Test available for the connected ECM(s).
Please establish a connection to view tests.
ECM Diagnostic tests are not supported with only Basic Registration. Please contact the local distributor.
Image Connections do not support ECM Diagnostic Tests.
The ECM Diagnostic test system is in an invalid state, please report this condition.
You are attempting to disconnect while a test is running. Are you sure you wish to proceed?
No ECM Diagnostic Test available for this module.

This test allows the user to activate the Injection Control Valve, Front Pumping Control Valve, and the Rear Pumping Control Valve for diagnostic purposes. A clicking sound indicates that the control valve is operating correctly. If a clicking sound is not heard, the valve may be seized or is not receiving an electrical signal for activation.
This test is used to cutout individual cylinders for troubleshooting cylinder misfires.

This test is intended for use in diagnosing problems with the Electronic Air Compressor feature (Smart Air Compressor). The test will allow a Technician to activate and deactivate the air compressor solenoid on command. An audible 'click' will indicate if the solenoid is activating and deactivating properly.
The Boost Override Test commands the engine to run on the 100% torque curve. The override prevents the engine from switching to a lower torque curve.
This test intended purpose is to help identify weak cylinders.
The EFC Actuator test is an automated test that will manually operate the actuator to ensure that it is functioning properly.
Allows the fan to be engaged at full speed for an adjustable amount of time
This test will eliminate any feedback from the heated oxygen sensor.
This test is used to manually turn ON/OFF the intake air heater solenoid(s)
The Fuel Lift Pump Override Test is an automated test that will manually operate the fuel lift pump and prime the fuel system to help eliminate any air in the system

This test allows the user to disable the pumping control valves one at a time for diagnostic purposes. The CAPS fuel pump has a front and a rear control valve (PCV) both of which are actuated by solenoids
The Electronic Smart Power (ESP) Lock-In Mode will allow the user to temporarily lock the ESP curve into high, low or normal horsepower for troubleshooting purposes.
This test will allow the user to override the Eaton Top 2 Autoshift solenoid drivers for troubleshooting purposes.
This test sounds the ICON Engine Start alarm, to confirm that the alarm is working properly.
This test will allow the user to set the PWM signal in percent Duty Cycle to control the electronic fan clutch
The EFC Actuator test is an automated test that will manually operate the actuator to ensure that it is functioning properly
This test will allow the user to activate the ICON Ignition Relay and Starter Relay / Interlocks for troubleshooting purposes.
This feature removes the electronic control restrictions for engine speed, power, and torque for engine performance testing on a dynamometer.
This test can be used to manually engage fast idle warmup to test the feature for the most suitable engine speed.
This test can be used to troubleshoot possible issues with the Aftertreatment system.
Please make sure Engine Speed is greater than zero and Vehicle Speed is equal to zero prior to starting the test.
Please make sure Engine Speed and Vehicle Speed are zero prior to starting the test.

STRING.CONTEXT: I18N WARNING! - Do not translate $p(200080). It is a variable.

RESOURCE.STRING:
The following steps must be performed before starting the Accelerator Based Cutout Test
1. The engine must be running and the vehicle must be stationary
2. Clear the areas around the engine and fan, make sure the exhaust is vented correctly
3. $p(200080)
4. Lock the Engine Fan in the "ON" position for continuous operation
5. Turn off the air conditioning, to avoid the air conditioning compressor cycling on and off during test operation
6. Ensure the vehicle air tanks are fully pressurized, to avoid air compressor cycling during test operation
7. Disengage any devices that can cause the load on the engine to vary
8. Vehicle stationary with the engine running
If the engine stalls, or communication with the ECM is lost during test operation, the keyswitch must be cycled to restore cylinders to their active state
Cylinders will be cut out for 15 seconds and RPM change recorded. If the RPM change is greater than 21 the cylinder has passed. If RPM change is less than 21 the cylinder has failed.
Please make sure Engine Speed and Vehicle Speed are zero prior to starting the test.
Engine Speed needs to be greater than zero prior to starting the test.
This test should only be performed while idling below 900 RPM and with the vehicle out of gear.
Select Start to monitor cylinder contributions or select Back to return to the ECM diagnostics tests wizard.
The EFC Actuator test will run for a maximum of 60 seconds after Start is pressed with the EFC Actuator checkbox is selected.
Allows the fan to be engaged at full speed for an adjustable amount of time
When changing the setting, a click should be heard if the grid heater is operative. Press 'Start' to begin the test.
The grid heaters are set to be on for xxx seconds. A click should be heard if the grid heater is operative. Press 'Start' to begin the test

Please make sure Engine Speed is at 0. Please also insure that Battery Voltage is above 10.5V, if a 12V Electrical System is used, or Battery Voltage is above 22V if a 24V Electrical System is being used.

This test will engage the starter and may cause the engine to turn over briefly. Perform the following steps before continuing :
1. Place transmission in neutral
2. Ensure engine compartment is clear
3. Set parking brake
4. Close hood or lower cab
Press the Start button to configure the control system for the dynamometer.
This test will start and run the engine fan for the specified period of time. Make sure the fan area is clear before starting the test.
The ESP Lock-In Mode test is not available in this calibration. ESP Lock-In Mode must be available in the calibration in order to run this test.
Please make sure Engine Speed and Vehicle Speed are zero prior to starting the test. Please select the solenoid desired to be overridden and press Start.
The EFC Actuator test will run for a maximum of 60 seconds after Start is pressed with the EFC Actuator checkbox is selected
Select Start to start the test
To manually test Fast Idle Warmup, select Engage to begin the test. Please cycle the keyswitch if INSITE is closed without first stopping or canceling this test.
Please be patient, there is approximately 5 minutes of delay time before the engine speed begins ramping to the desired fast idle warmup speed.
If necessary, change Fast Idle Warmup Speed and select Adjust to send the change to the ECM temporarily. To make the change permanently, modify Fast Idle Warmup Speed using Features and Parameters.
Please make sure engine is running prior to starting the test.
This test will start and run the engine fan for the set PWM signal. Make sure the fan area is clear before starting the test.

The following steps must be performed before starting the Accelerator Based Cutout Test
1. The engine must be running and the vehicle must be stationary.
2. Clear the areas around the engine and fan, make sure the exhaust is vented correctly.
3. Operate the engine until the engine coolant temperature is a minimum of 170 degrees F (77 degrees C).
4. Lock the Engine Fan in the "ON" position for continuous operation.
5. Turn off the air conditioning, to avoid the air conditioning compressor cycling on and off during test operation.
6. Ensure the vehicle air tanks are fully pressurized, to avoid air compressor cycling during test operation.
7. Disengage any devices that can cause the load on the engine to vary.
8. Vehicle stationary with the engine running.

If the engine stalls, or communication with the ECM is lost during test operation, the keyswitch must be cycled to restore cylinders to their active state.
Cylinders will be cut out for 15 seconds and RPM change recorded. If the RPM change is 21 or greater the cylinder has passed. If RPM change is less than 21 the cylinder has failed.
This test is not supported with the current calibration.

Active Fault Codes are present in the ECM. In order to run the test, there cannot be any active faults in the ECM. Please ensure no Fault Codes are present prior to starting the test. The test has been terminated.
ECM Diagnostic tests are not supported with only Basic Registration. Please contact the local distributor.
This test will not run unless the ICON hardware is installed and ICON is enabled.
There is a test running. You must stop the active test before exiting.
Image Connections do not support ECM Diagnostic Tests
ECM Diagnostic tests is in an invalid state, please report this error.
There are no ECM Diagnostic Tests available for the currently connected engine.

Fast Idle Warmup is currently disabled. If you want to run the fast idle warmup test, please exit the test window, enable Fast Idle Warmup under the Features and Parameters menu, and return to the test.
The value you have specified for Fan Percent Request is out of range. It must be in the range 0-100.
Value entered is out of the proper range. Please enter a different value.
Front Pumping Control Valve is activated.
Rear Pumping Control Valve is activated.
Engine Oil Temperature is too low.
Engine Coolant Temperature is too low.
Required Engine Speed can not be reached. Check engine for fault codes and performance related problems that limit Engine Speed.

STRING.CONTEXT: I18N WARNING! - Do not translate $d(calcCylinderNum). It is a variable

RESOURCE.STRING: Cylinder number $d(cylinderNum) has been cut out. Collecting data to calculate RPM change.

STRING.CONTEXT: I18N WARNING! - Do not translate $d(cutoutCylinder)$d(roundedRPMChange_value)$d(cylStatusValue). These are variables.

RESOURCE.STRING: Cylinder number $d(cylinderNum) has been cut out and RPM change is $d(roundedRPMChange_value). Cylinder $d(cylinderNum) has $d(cylStatusValue).
This test is not supported by the calibration or the hardware on the engine.
The Fuel Lift Pump will automatically run for approximately xxx seconds after the key switch is turned on. This test will not override the fuel lift pump during that time.

STRING.CONTEXT: I18N WARNING! - Do not translate $p(104018)$d(roundedIntakeTempFinalConv). These are variables.

RESOURCE.STRING: INSITE has detected that the Intake Manifold Temperature is above the calibrated threshold required for this test to continue. Please wait till the Intake Manifold Temperature has dropped below $p(104018) degrees Fahrenheit ( $d(roundedIntakeTempFinalConv) degrees Celsius).

STRING.CONTEXT: I18N WARNING! - Do not translate $p(104019)$d(roundedCoolantTempFinalConv). These are variables.

RESOURCE.STRING: INSITE has detected that the Coolant Temperature is above the calibrated threshold for this test to continue. Please wait till the Coolant Temperature has dropped below $p(104019) degrees Fahrenheit ($d(roundedCoolantTempFinalConv) degrees Celsius).
The engine is set to run on the 100% torque curve.
The engine is set to run in normal operation.
Engine speed has exceeded 900 rpm test maximum limit. Test will resume when engine speed falls below 900 rpm.
Test has been paused. Current contribution values are displayed.
The Fuel Lift Pump Override Test has exceeded maximum allowable time limit. Key off and restart test
SAE J1939 Datalink Control is Enabled.
SAE J1939 Datalink Control is Disabled.
Maximum allowable test time has been exceeded. Please select Engage to restart the test.
Fast Idle Warmup is now active
All Pumping Control Valves are active.
No changes made, please wait until Fast Idle Warmup is Active before selecting Adjust.
The test is adjusting engine throttle. This process may take a few minutes.
For misfire detection ensure the Engine Coolant Temperature is above 170 degrees F (77 degrees C).
INSITE has detected no Engine Speed. Please start the engine, and restart the test.
INSITE has detected Vehicle Speed. Please reduce speed to zero, and restart the test.
INSITE has detected Engine Speed. Please reduce Engine Speed to zero, and restart the test.
INSITE has detected both Engine Speed and Vehicle Speed. Please reduce both speeds to zero, and restart the test.
Test stopped, no engine speed detected.
Test stopped, vehicle speed detected. Stop vehicle and restart test.
Engine Speed detected. Shutdown engine, key on, and restart test.
This test is not supported with the current calibration and hardware setup.
Allows the fan to be engaged at full speed for an adjustable amount of time
INSITE has detected Engine Speed is less than 600 rpm.
The Fuel Lift Pump Override Test is not available for this engine. No fuel lift pump is installed.
Low battery voltage detected. Troubleshoot the low battery voltage fault code before proceeding with this test.
Other Device is controlling Engine. Disconnect appropriate datalink.
The test was not started because Engine Speed was not greater than 600 rpm.
Vehicle is moving. Stop vehicle and restart test.
PTO is active. Turn off PTO.
Cummins Service Tool is overriding TVO State. Disconnect appropriate tool.
Limp home state active. Check for active Fault Codes.
Governor type is Variable Speed. Change to Automotive and restart test.
Cruise Control is active. Turn off Cruise Control.
Vehicle is moving. Stop vehicle and restart test.
Increase engine RPM by increasing % Accelerator.
Decrease engine RPM by decreasing % Accelerator.
The test was not started because the Vehicle Speed was greater than 0.
The test was aborted because the Vehicle Speed was greater than 0.
Engine Protection activated. Check for active fault codes.
Decrease engine RPM by decreasing % Accelerator.
Other Device is controlling Engine. Disconnect appropriate datalink.
Vehicle is moving. Stop vehicle and restart test.
Cummins Service Tool is overriding TVO State. Disconnect appropriate tool.
Engine Break is ON. Turn OFF Engine Break.
Decrease engine RPM by decreasing % Accelerator.
Engine Stopped. Start engine and restart test.
The test was aborted because the Engine Speed was less than 600 rpm.
Accelerator Interlock is active. Correct Accelerator Interlock.
Alternate Torque is active. Turn off Alternate Torque.
The current calibration does not support the Eaton Top 2 Autoshift Feature.
The test was not started because the vehicle speed sensor signal was lost.
The test was not started because the vehicle speed sensor was in an unknown state.
The test was aborted because the vehicle speed sensor signal was lost.
The test was aborted because the vehicle speed sensor was in an unknown state.
The test was aborted because engine speed has exceeded the test limit. Please ensure the fuel system is operating correctly before restarting the test.
Fuel Control Valve Initial Position Setup
Manual Fuel Control Valve Adjustment Test
Switch and Sensor Intermittent Connection Test
Starter Lockout Relay Driver Override Test
Electric Fuel Lift Pump Override Test
Aftertreatment Shutoff Valve and Injector Override Test
VGT Electronic Actuator Installation and Calibration
Diesel Exhaust Fluid Doser Pump Override Test
Diesel Exhaust Fluid Doser Pump Air Solenoid Click Test
Diesel Exhaust Fluid Doser System Heater Test
Switch and Sensor Intermittent Connection Test
Aftertreatment Diesel Exhaust Fluid System Leak Test
